citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The three named community members of the IACUC are employees of the institution in departments other than
Veterinary Science. Appointing IACUC community members that are affiliated with the facility compromises the ability of
those members to provide representation for the general community interests in the proper care and treatment of animals
used in the research program. At least one IACUC member shall not be affiliated in any way with the facility other than as
a member of the Committee and shall not be a member of the immediate family of a person who is affiliated with the
facility.
Correct by 27 October 2023.

citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The facility representative stated the IACUC has not prepared any reports of their semiannual reviews nor forwarded
semiannual reports to the Institutional Official. One of the IACUC functions is to assess activities involving animals at the
research facility and report its evaluations to the Institutional Official to ensure they are kept informed of the status of both
the animal use program and the research facilities. The IACUC shall prepare reports of its semiannual reviews and submit
the reports to the Institutional Official of the research facility at least once every 6 months.
Correct from this date forward of 31 August 2023 for all future semiannual reviews.

The Annual Report for FY 2022 underreported the number of animals used in research. Correct reporting of all required
information on the annual report is required so that the public, USDA APHIS Animal Care, and Congress can have
knowledge of the number, type, and pain category of animals used- or held for use in research. Each reporting facility
shall submit an annual report to the Deputy Administrator on or before December 1 of each calendar year covering the
previous fiscal year and stating the common names and numbers of animals used in each pain category.
Correct by 20 October 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.31(b)(3)(ii) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The three named community members of the IACUC are employees of the institution in departments other than 
Veterinary Science. Appointing IACUC community members that are affiliated with the facility compromises the ability of 
those members to provide representation for the general community interests in the proper care and treatment of animals 
used in the research program. At least one IACUC member shall not be affiliated in any way with the facility other than as 
a member of the Committee and shall not be a member of the immediate family of a person who is affiliated with the 
facility. 
 
Correct by 27 October 2023. 
2.31(c)(3) 
   
Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC). 
The facility representative stated the IACUC has not prepared any reports of their semiannual reviews nor forwarded 
semiannual reports to the Institutional Official. One of the IACUC functions is to assess activities involving animals at the 
research facility and report its evaluations to the Institutional Official to ensure they are kept informed of the status of both 
the animal use program and the research facilities. The IACUC shall prepare reports of its semiannual reviews and submit 
the reports to the Institutional Official of the research facility at least once every 6 months. 
 
Correct from this date forward of 31 August 2023 for all future semiannual reviews. 
2.36(a) 
   
Annual report. 
The Annual Report for FY 2022 underreported the number of animals used in research. Correct reporting of all required 
information on the annual report is required so that the public, USDA APHIS Animal Care, and Congress can have 
knowledge of the number, type, and pain category of animals used- or held for use in research. Each reporting facility 
shall submit an annual report to the Deputy Administrator on or before December 1 of each calendar year covering the 
previous fiscal year and stating the common names and numbers of animals used in each pain category.

Correct by 20 October 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
